deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

documentation.text:
@title SafeMath
 @dev Math operations with safety checks that throw on error

@title ERC20 interface
 @dev see https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20

@title Basic token
 @dev Basic version of StandardToken, with no allowances.

Modifier avoids short address attacks.
 For more info check: https://ericrafaloff.com/analyzing-the-erc20-short-address-attack/

approve should be called when allowed[_spender] == 0. To increment
 allowed value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until 
 the first transaction is mined)
 From MonolithDAO Token.sol

@dev The Ownable constructor sets the original `owner` of the contract to the sender
 account.
@dev Throws if called by any account other than the owner.

@dev Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.
 @param newOwner The address to transfer ownership to.
@dev Constructor that gives the founder all of the existing tokens.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Optimized airdrop mode is not enabled."

arguments.value: Optimized airdrop mode is not enabled.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Optimized airdrop mode is not enabled."

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "The Crypto Multisender contract address has no tokens to distribute."

arguments.value: The Crypto Multisender contract address has no tokens to distribute.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "The Crypto Multisender contract address has no tokens to distribute."

documentation.text:
@title SafeMath
 @dev Math operations with safety checks that throw on error

@title ERC20 interface
 @dev see https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20

@title Basic token
 @dev Basic version of StandardToken, with no allowances.

Modifier avoids short address attacks.
 For more info check: https://ericrafaloff.com/analyzing-the-erc20-short-address-attack/

approve should be called when allowed[_spender] == 0. To increment
 allowed value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until 
 the first transaction is mined)
 From MonolithDAO Token.sol

@dev The Ownable constructor sets the original `owner` of the contract to the sender
 account.
@dev Throws if called by any account other than the owner.

@dev Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.
 @param newOwner The address to transfer ownership to.
@dev Constructor that gives the founder all of the existing tokens.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Optimized airdrop mode is not enabled."
